revised_title: Researches on the Foraminifera: Fourth and Concluding Series
tldr: The author examines various types of Foraminifera, focusing on their structural and physiological characteristics. He discusses the canal system in Polystomella and Calcarina, and the intermediate skeleton's role in their growth. The author also describes the unique structure of Tinoporus and its relationship to Orbitoides, as well as the link between Foraminifera and Sponges in the Caipenteria species.
